definition: to undergo change in weather/restoration of reactionary rule or the previous regime
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: In anticipation of bad weather they took plenty of warm clothes.
sentences.chinese: 他們預料到會變天而帶了很多厚衣服。

sentences.english: The weather forecast said it would change this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 預報說今天下午開始變天。

sentences.english: The wind is howling. The weather looks like turning nasty.
sentences.chinese: 風呼呼地颳着，好像要變天了。

sentences.english: Perhaps the weather will change this evening.
In anticipation of bad weather they take plenty of warm clothes.
sentences.chinese: 他們預料到會變天而帶了很多厚衣服。

sentences.english: The butterfly is really among the swan-ugly duckling school of butterflies.
sentences.chinese: 這種蝴蝶可真是蝴蝶家族中醜小鴨變天鵝的一員了。

definition: tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
lit. wind from an empty cave (idiom)/fig. unfounded (story)/baseless (claim)
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
